overview.title: Project Overview
paragraphs: This template is designed to provide a production-ready foundation for modern web applications. It leverages the speed of Vite with the SEO benefits of SSG.

The directory structure is organized by feature, making it easy to scale as your application grows. Components are built using Shadcn UI, providing a consistent and accessible design system out of the box.
Internationalization (i18n) is baked in from the start, allowing you to easily support multiple languages without significant refactoring later.

carousel.title: Core Concepts
carousel.subtitle: Understanding the key technologies powering this template.

slides.title: 1. Static Site Generation
slides.subtitle: Pre-rendering for speed and SEO.
bullets: Pages are generated at build time, resulting in static HTML files.
Fast Time-to-First-Byte (TTFB) since no server-side processing is needed.
Perfect for content-heavy sites, blogs, and marketing pages.
Can be hosted on any static file server or CDN.

slides.title: 2. Modern React
slides.subtitle: Hooks, Components, and TypeScript.
bullets: Built with React 18, leveraging the latest hook patterns.
Strict TypeScript configuration ensures type safety across the codebase.
Component-driven development with a clear separation of concerns.
Optimized for performance with code-splitting and lazy loading.

slides.title: 3. Styling System
slides.subtitle: Tailwind CSS + Shadcn UI.
bullets: Utility-first CSS via Tailwind for rapid styling without leaving HTML.
Shadcn UI provides accessible, unstyled components that you own.
Dark mode support is built-in and respects system preferences.
Easy customization via CSS variables and Tailwind config.

slides.title: 4. Internationalization
slides.subtitle: i18next for global reach.
bullets: Translation files are separated by language and namespace.
Language detection and persistence via local storage.
Seamless switching between languages without page reloads.

process.title: Deployment Workflow
steps: Run `pnpm build` to generate the static files in the `dist` directory.
Preview the build locally using `pnpm preview` to ensure everything looks correct.
Configure your host (Vercel, Netlify, Github Pages) to serve the `dist` folder.
Set up a CI/CD pipeline (e.g., GitHub Actions) to automate builds on push.
Verify the deployed site, checking for 404s and proper asset loading.
